settings.heading: UTR-P: OFFICIAL RATING OF USA PICKLEBALL

settings.text: UTR Sports is proud to partner with USA Pickleball to provide a gold-standard pickleball rating to allow for more fairness and FUN! If you have played in an APP or USA Pickleball event, you most likely already have a profile and will just need to claim it! If you are new to the sport, register and receive your UTR-P Rating 100% free!

settings.heading: CONVERTING UTPR TO UTR PICKLEBALL RATING
settings.list: IMPORTANT: The UTR Pickleball Rating is generally one point higher than the UTPR you may be used to, as you can see in the corresponding chart of a few examples.
settings.list2: It's also important to note that the UTPR and UTR Pickleball Rating systems are very different in terms of their approaches and how the ratings are calculated.
settings.list3: The UTR Pickleball Rating consists of an ageless, genderless, borderless scale from 1-10.0, updating every 24 hours.
settings.list4: The UTPR is a tournament-only rating system for the U.S. on a scale from 1 to 5.5+.

settings.heading: CONVERTING UTPR TO UTR PICKLEBALL RATING
settings.description: The UTPR and UTR Pickleball Rating ating systems are very different in terms of their approaches and how the ratings are calculated. The UTR Pickleball Rating consists of an ageless, genderless, borderless scale from 1-10.0, updating every 24 hours. The UTPR is a tournament-only rating system for the United States on a scale from 1 to 5.5+ (learn more here).The DUPR is a global rating system on a scale from 2.00 to 8.00.The UTR-P Rating is generally one point higher than the UTPR you may be used to.Examples: If a player has been a 3.0 UTPR, they will be approximately a 4.0 UTR-P; if a player has been a 3.5 UTPR, they will be approximately a 4.5 UTR-P; and if a player has been a 5.5+ UTPR, they will be approximately a 6.5+ UTR-P.

settings.heading: CONVERTING UTPR TO UTR PICKLEBALL RATING
settings.description: USA Pickleball ambassadors will launch innovative leagues and events for adults, juniors, and collegiate players. League organizers and participants will leverage the UTR tournament platform to run all league activities and events.

settings.heading: WHY IS UTR PICKLEBALL RATING THE BEST?
settings.list: UTR Sports has over a decade of experience in building world-class comprehensive global ratings.
settings.list2: UTR Pickleball Rating is fully integrated into the most comprehensive and best-in-breed event, tournament, and league software.
settings.list3: UTR-P has more investment, expertise, and experience than any other pickleball rating. UTR-P is based on points won, NOT games.
settings.list4: UTR-P is the most reliable pickleball rating: Players with less than 6 matches have no impact on players with more than 6 matches. This prevents sandbagging! Players must be close enough in level for the match to count.

settings.heading: TESTIMONIALS
How does the UTR-P Rating scale work?
settings.row_content:
1 = Beginner: New to the game with minimal racquet sports experience (provisional rating equivalent of P1)

2 = Social/Casual: Plays on occasion for fun and can maintain rallies (provisional rating equivalent of P2)

3 = Intermediate: Has a solid understanding of basics and strategic knowledge with an interest in competitive play (provisional rating equivalent of P3)

4.0-4.9 = Advanced: Consistent shot maker who can compete in advanced-level tournaments (provisional rating equivalent of P4)

5.0-10.0 = Expert/Pro: Master of all shots and strategies who participates at the highest levels of competition (provisional rating equivalent of P5)

The algorithm counts singles, doubles, verified, and unverified ratings separately and it changes dynamically to keep your rating as accurate as possible.

Read more about the UTR Pickleball Rating.

settings.heading: Why isn't there a separate gendered doubles rating and mixed doubles rating?
settings.row_content:
The UTR-P rating was specifically developed with sophistication around the data science needed to provide for an accurate genderless doubles rating. Meaning, you can rely on the UTR-P double ratings for gendered or mixed doubles.

This way, finding a good mixed doubles partner is simple — just look for a person with a UTR-P rating around your level in doubles either male or female. The UTR-P Rating reflects how you individually play in a doubles match.

settings.heading: What is the UTR Pickleball Rating (UTR-P)?
settings.row_content:
Equipped with over a decade of expertise as the creator of the gold-standard UTR Rating for tennis, UTR Sports offers the most accurate and reliable global rating for pickleball. 

The UTR-P is designed to rate every kind of player, whether you're just swinging your first paddle or smashing your way through pro-level tournaments. The UTR Pickleball Rating (UTR-P) includes both provisional and numerical ratings for singles and doubles players. 

Players without match results logged will receive a provisional rating (P1-P5) based on a questionnaire. After a few matches, the rating automatically converts to a reliable decimal rating on a scale of 1 - 10.0 (from beginner to expert/pro).

Read more about the UTR Pickleball Rating.

settings.heading: Why has my rating changed so much in the transition from UTPR to UTR-P?
settings.row_content:
Transitioning from a smaller 1.0-6.0 scale UTPR that included limited USA tournaments to the global UTR-P scale of 1.0-10.0, results in players’ ratings naturally moving up and changing as they continue to compete.

The 10-point scale is nearly twice as large as the UTPR 6.0-point scale, so it is normal and expected for our rating to see more movement for players. In turn, players can have a higher rating spread from their partners.

settings.heading: Why am I not in the same division any longer with my partner?
settings.row_content:
Every team can play with their partners. All teams are required to play in the division of the highest-rated partner in doubles or mixed doubles.

Your opponents are moving up as well, so there is no reason to worry that the level of play or competition will be significantly higher if you register in a higher division. You can view more of this movement by looking at your and/or your opponents’ ratings on the UTR Sports website.

settings.heading: What matches count towards the UTR-P Rating, and what is verified vs. unverified?
settings.row_content:
Results are either verified or unverified scores depending on whether the match or tournament was organized and played according to UTR Sports’ verified rules, or the match or tournament was a player organized/social/recreational, for which scores are unverified.

All USA Pickleball-owned events, all APP events, and all UTR Sports events are verified events. The UTR-P algorithm takes into account up to 60 of your most recent matches.

A verified UTR-P Rating is indicated by a checkmark badge on a player’s profile. Ratings will dynamically move up and down as new results are factored in.

settings.heading: What does it mean that UTR-P will now be the USA Pickleball’s standard rating and ranking?
settings.row_content: USA Pickleball and UTR Sports have entered into a landmark partnership to connect, grow, and unite the pickleball community. Part of that partnership is establishing the UTR-P Rating as the new standard rating for the sport.

settings.heading: What will happen to UTPR (USA Pickleball Tournament Player Ratings)?
settings.row_content: With the USA Pickleball and UTR Sports partnership, USA Pickleball is sunsetting all UTPR ratings and using the UTR-P Rating. Learn more.

settings.heading: I have a Golden Ticket for the 2024 Biofreeze USA Pickleball National Championships. What skill division will I be playing?
settings.row_content:
Transitioning from the smaller UTPR 1.0-6.0 scale that included limited USA tournaments to the global UTR-P scale of 1.0-10.0 has resulted in players’ ratings naturally moving up and changing as they continue to compete.

The 10-point scale is nearly twice as large as the UTPR 6.0-point scale, so it's expected for players to experience rating movement in this transition. Players may have a higher rating spread from their partners as well.

settings.heading: Can a player enter any division of a USA Pickleball or USAP-sanctioned event regardless of UTR-P Rating?
settings.row_content:
Using the UTR Sports platform, event organizers have flexibility for how open or restricted  divisions are set up. It will be up to the organizer’s discretion, and it is possible to have open divisions where players may be placed into groups within a division using their rating as a guide to ensure level-based play.

USA Pickleball membership verification is integrated into the UTR Sports platform.

settings.heading: Why should I be confident in the UTR-P Rating?
settings.row_content: From the makers of the world’s most accurate rating system with patented technology, UTR Sports’ capabilities in algorithm development and data science is a strength no other organization in the sport has come close to matching. UTR Sports monitors the rating continuously and refines the analytics around the algorithm to watch for edge cases, inflation, and fraud. We measure our accuracy against pickleball pro points rankings and have statistically significant advantages in predicting winners.

settings.heading: Have more questions about USA Pickleball & UTR Sports partnership?
settings.row_content:
Contact UTR Sports support with any questions at usaphelp@utrsports.net.

Find more FAQs at the UTR Pickleball Rating page.

settings.heading: Can I participate in another event in the same week?
settings.row_content:
When a player is accepted into the Qualifying or Main Draw of a Tournament as Direct Acceptance or Wild Card at any time after the Registration Deadline they are Committed to that PTT tournament, without exception.

A player who is committed to and/or has played in the Main Draw or Qualifying of a PTT tournament may not enter or compete in any other tennis event during the period of such tournament, without exception.

Players may not be accepted into any other tournaments during the same week. Players will be withdrawn from all but one Tournament at the Withdrawal Deadline based on the withdrawal procedure described above. If a player is found after the Withdrawal Deadline to have been accepted into two Tournaments in one week, they will be withdrawn from one Tournament at the earliest opportunity, also according to the withdrawal procedure set out above.

Playing another event will result in a $1,000 fine and up to a two month suspension from all UTR events.

settings.heading: How will I get paid?
settings.row_content: UTR Sports will pay the prize money to all players participating in the Tournament in accordance with the UTR Pro Tennis Tour prize money breakdowns (“Prize Money”), unless otherwise noted. Universal Tennis will make prize money payable by bank transfer available to eligible players.

settings.heading: I am travelling to a tournament. What arrangements should I make in advance?
settings.row_content:
Prior to departing for a tournament, a player should do the following:

1. Check relevant travel and security information about the country you are traveling to.

Examples: https://www.iatatravelcentre.com/world.php

2. It is recommended that players obtain travel insurance to cover flight cancellations and other disruptions in travel.

3. Print all relevant tournament information, such as tournament site address, phone number, the PTT PM and head referee number, hotel address and contact number, etc.

4. Confirm the appropriate Visa has been obtained and all necessary Travel Documents.

settings.heading: How do I handle threats, offensive and unwanted messages?
settings.row_content: If you are receiving any emails, SMS messages, Facebook, Twitter or other social media messages and/or images that you are concerned about, send a copy of the message, screenshot and the URL to ptt@universaltennis.com or talk to a member of onsite venue staff, ideally the Referee or TD for assistance. For any betting-related messages, please send to integrity@universaltennis.com. Universal Tennis takes player safety seriously and has a policy to report all hostile messages sent to players to authorities with jurisdiction over such matters as well as we take steps to identify the messenger immediately. Learn more about PTT Social Media Safety.

settings.heading: FAQS About UTR PICKLEBALL RATING
UTR-P: Rating standard for USA Pickleball
settings.description: USA Pickleball has adopted the UTR Pickleball (UTR-P) Rating and UTR tournament management software for all USAP-owned and operated events, including Golden Ticket events and the 2025 USA Pickleball National Championships.

settings.heading: JOIN UTR SPORTS
settings.paragrap-title: It’s easier than ever to enjoy more tennis and pickleball and connect with players near you on the UTR Sports app.

settings.heading: establish the best playing experience possible.
settings.list: The APP Junior Circuit offers a world-class tournament experience exclusively for pickleball players under the age of 18.
settings.list2: APP Junior Circuit is a pilot program that provides a platform and resources for junior pickleball players to hone their skills.
settings.list3: Players will obtain an APP Junior Circuit rating for their age divisions played.
settings.list4: Rating points will be awarded for each player’s placement in events, and all players can participate in the APP Junior National Championships, held Dec. 6-7 at The Fort, the APP’s headquarters in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

settings.heading: TRAIN AT APP CAMPS
settings.list: The APP is running two APP Next Gen High Performance Summer Camps in 2024: Oklahoma City, OK June 27-30 and Overland Park, KS August 1-4.
settings.list2: The camps are led by APP Next Gen U.S. National Team Director, Ken Herrmann and Head Coaches Lee Whitwell and Chad Edwards.
settings.list3: This is a unique opportunity to learn how to take your game to the pro level from two world-class pickleball experts.
settings.list4: The camps are designed for junior players from around the world, ages 10 -18. Whether you’re a newcomer to pickleball, or a highly-ranked and rated player looking for more intense competition, the APP has the program for you.
